article.title: The translational side of topological band insulators

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the vector \'b\' in Figure 1 represent?
choices: Direction vector of the dislocation line.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the quantity δi represent in Formula 2?
choices: The product of the Pfaffian at all time-reversal invariant points.
The sign of the Pfaffian at a specific time-reversal invariant point Γi.
The determinant of the matrix of overlaps at Γi.
The energy gap at the time-reversal invariant point Γi.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula 3 describes the condition for the formation of what physical phenomenon?
What does the presence of dislocation modes in the X −Y valley phase of Figure 2 indicate?
choices: The phase is a strong topological insulator.
The phase is characterized by a non-trivial Chern number.
The phase is protected by translational symmetry.
The phase is unstable to perturbations.
